alert.note: Alert for Perry; Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 09 at 1:30AM CST until January 09 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... Southwestern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 200 AM CST. * At 130 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Macedonia, or 7 miles east of Petal, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Perry and southwestern Wayne Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
